title: Understanding the Problem
text: The total number of cupcakes sold is 5,000. The chocolate flavor is $$3$$ times as popular as the vanilla flavor. This means that for every vanilla cupcake sold, $$3$$ chocolate cupcakes are sold.

title: Cupcakes sold
text: Let $$x$$ represent the number of vanilla cupcakes sold per day. Then, the number of chocolate cupcakes sold will be $$3x$$, because chocolate is $$3$$ times as popular as vanilla.

title: Setting up the Equation
text: The total number of cupcakes sold is 5,000, so we can write the equation $$4x=5000$$.

title: Substitution
text: Now that you have $$x$$, the number of vanilla cupcakes sold, multiply by $$3$$ to find the number of chocolate cupcakes sold.
